channel.title: So two weeks after my area flooded... It floods again
channel.description:
This time it wasnt the river, It rained so much it just turned hillside roads into rivers.
Just to let everyone know too.. Most people have only just had there homes/busines's dried out and decontaminated and unfortunatly as technicly its a flood plain area the insurance WILL NOT pay out for any flood damage / items lost.
And unfortunatly due to it not being caused by the river, the flood sirens did not go off (they go off as the river reaches a certain point) So there was no warning.
[img]http://a8.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc7/482099_10151088936062891_1018184346_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a1.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/251933_10100484547849635_98817742_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/s720x720/251895_10151061984918891_932586391_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/527976_10150967174683611_1845022576_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a8.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/s720x720/252750_4095410699502_827160177_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a3.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/s720x720/396902_10151916721445370_716344853_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a1.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/s720x720/557041_408281442557107_407161090_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a2.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/s720x720/555500_4095409259466_969800118_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a8.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-prn1/s720x720/561143_10151923262325065_1886314702_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a7.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc7/s720x720/293707_10150921049922742_383194412_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a2.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/s720x720/580778_10150918050841398_434379047_n.jpg[/img] [img]http://a3.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash3/s720x720/599438_10151941577925601_896103249_n.jpg[/img]
If anyone wants me to post the videos i will.

item.title: So two weeks after my area flooded... It floods again
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

So punch taverns have decided that because of the floods and the cost of refurbing their pubs in my area they are selling the buildings (The pub i work at will apparently cost close to £1million to fully refurb)

So yeah, they are responsible for pretty much killing the pub trade in my area…

Read full topic
item.source: So two weeks after my area flooded... It floods again

item.title: So two weeks after my area flooded... It floods again
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

That land-rover in the video didn’t “only just make it”. It could have gone in water deeper than that!

As long as the driver isn’t stupid and keeps the bow wave going, then the air intake wont even be anywhere near the water. Air intakes on defenders are on the right hand side below the bonnet line in front of the drivers door. See the picture below, highlighted by the red circle.

(Also that is a diesel landy, which will survive much much better in deeper water than said petrol V8s that drown relatively easily, see: wet dizzy)

Psssh noobs.

Read full topic

item.source: So two weeks after my area flooded... It floods again

item.title: So two weeks after my area flooded... It floods again
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Not that we live in a flood prone area, but our house is about 1,5m above street level, which pretty much covers us from a flood should it ever occur.

There were people ontop of the hills in the valley that got hit by the flash floods coming off the tops… People thought they were safe from it haha, There is a road up on the hill by me, theres a track that goes up to someones house that had tarmac on it (asphalt) and one of the flash floods had eroded all the tarmax and eroded 4ft down

Also we’ve been on the local and national news all today and yesterday for the floods

EDIT: Here is one of the roads im talking about

PS heres the news link

The landrover seen in the video, I was right behind that but wisely chose to go the longway round

amazing the power of water

Read full topic
